page.title: 02BRIERLEY COURT HOP FARM
page.content: Brierley Court is the{largest hop {farm}in W Europe.The actual farm is 407 acres,and hops are grown on 246 acres;the rest being taken up by sheds,paths,river, grazing, orchards and cereals. Hops have been grown for over a hundred years at Brierley Court because the soil is deep and full of moisture;the fields lying in the flood plain of the{RIVER ARROW.The{growing {season}is from{March September,}the busiest time of the year being from May to September.Ten full time employees are augmented by eighty part time workers, recruited locally for the hop tying, (May/June), harvesting, drying and packing (Aug/Sept). Where possible machinery is used; {bine loaders}for collecting bines and special machinery for harvesting the hops, drying and packing.
